subject: Re: The goals of CMM (Re: [junit] wanted Junit professionals urgently)
msgSnippet: ... When I say a lot easier, I mean that you simply may not be able to find enough talented programmers. Given two weeks, try to hire a dozen top-notch
messageBody:
On Wed, 27 Aug 2003, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> Curt Sampson wrote:
>
> > Unfortuantely, it can be a lot easier to hire five, or even twenty,
> > not-so-talented programmers than one talented one.
>
> So it costs less to spend more? Great. Just when I think I begin to
> understand business people....

When I say "a lot easier," I mean that you simply may not be able to
find enough talented programmers. Given two weeks, try to hire a dozen
top-notch programmers, while paying salaries at the going rate. You
may find it's much more difficult than you think. Certainly I've had
difficulties this way when I've had to do hiring.

cjs
--
Curt Sampson <cjs@...> +81 90 7737 2974 http://www.NetBSD.org
Don't you know, in this new Dark Age, we're all light. --XTC
